data.title: 387 Representative Expression Characteristics
data.text:
A characteristic of an expression that is considered a canonical source of data for identifying a work.

For information on punctuation, see the Punctuation section below.

An indication of the presence of color or tone in the content of a representative expression of a work. For a list of RDA-controlled terms, see RDA Colour Content.

A categorization of a representative expression that reflects the fundamental form of communication in which the content is expressed and the human sense through which it is intended to be perceived. For a list of RDA-controlled terms, see RDA Content Type.

An extent of expression of a representative expression of a work that is a playing time, performance time, running time, or other length of time. For details on recording duration, see field 306 subfield Ça.

130 0 Â Once upon a time in America (Motion picture) 245 1 0 Once upon a time in America / Çc The Ladd Company ; Warner Bros ; Embassy International Pictures ; Empax Films ; directed by Sergio Leone ; produced by Arnon Milchan ; screenplay by Leonardo Benvenuti, Piero De Bernardi, Enrico Medioli, Franco Arcalli, Franco Ferrini, Sergio Leone 250 Â Â [Long version] 264 Â 1 United States : Çb The Ladd Company : Çb Warner Bros., Çc 1985 300 Â Â Ç3 viewing print: Ça 24 film reels of 24 on 12 (approximately 226 min., approximately 20,340 ft.) Çb sound, color ; Çc 35 mm 387 Â Â Çb polychrome Ç2 rdacc 387 Â Â Çe 1985 Ç2 edtf 387 Â Â Çf 034600 387 Â Â Çm sound Ç2 rdasco 500 Â Â The shortened edited version of this film was released in 1984. Per M/B/RS descriptions file (New York times, 10-22-1992), the long version (also called "director's cut") has been shown sporadically at movie houses, is available on home video and was also released theatrically in 1991. LC also holds the shortened edited version of this film

A category of user for whom a representative expression of a work is intended, or for whom a representative expression of a work is considered suitable. For a list of source terms/codes, see Target Audience Code and Term Source Codes.

A language term or code used for the content of a representative expression of a work. For a list of source terms/codes, see Language Code and Term Source Codes.

A method or system used to represent the surface of the earth or of a celestial sphere on a plane in a representative expression of a work.

A ratio of the dimensions of a representative expression of an image or three-dimensional form to the dimensions of the thing that is represented.

245 0 2 A new Mapp of the Kingdome of England, Representing the Princedome of Wales, and other Provinces, ... with the Roads from Town to Town ... Printed and given out at Amsteldam by Nicolas Visscher ... and are to be sould at London by John Overton ... 255 Â Â Scale 1:1,200,000 264 Â 1 Çc [1685?] 300 Â Â 1 map ; Çc 75 x 58 cm 387 Â Â Çk Scale 1:1,200,000 700 1 Â Overton, John, Çd 1640-1708? 700 1 Â Visscher, Claes Jansz., Çd 1586 or 1587-1652

MARC code that identifies the source of the term or code used to record the representative expression information.

For more information about subfield Ç2, see Control Subfields.

Data that link fields when non-Latin script is entered. This subfield is system supplied and does not appear in OCLC online displays. Do not manually add subfield Ç6. For more information about subfield Ç6, see Control Subfields.
